001package ca.gc.cra.radar.application.pipeline;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.FlowAssembler;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.MessageReconstructor;
005import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.MetricsPort;
006import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PairingEngine;
007import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.PersistencePort;
008import ca.gc.cra.radar.application.port.ProtocolDetector;
009import ca.gc.cra.radar.config.AssembleConfig;
010import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.capture.SegmentRecord;
011import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.flow.FlowDirectionService;
012import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.msg.MessagePair;
013import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.FiveTuple;
014import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.net.TcpSegment;
015import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.protocol.ProtocolId;
016import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.persistence.SegmentIoAdapter;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Map;
019import java.util.Objects;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.function.Supplier;
022import org.slf4j.Logger;
023import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
024import org.slf4j.MDC;
025
026/**
027 * Replays captured segment records to reconstruct higher-level protocol message pairs.
028 * <p>Coordinates the {@link FlowProcessingEngine} with persistence and metrics. Not thread-safe;
029 * intended for single-threaded batch execution.</p>
030 *
031 * @implNote Tracks flow orientation using {@link FlowDirectionService} to determine client/server side
032 * for synthesized {@link TcpSegment} instances.
033 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
034 */
035public final class AssembleUseCase {
036  private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(AssembleUseCase.class);
037
038  private final AssembleConfig config;
039  private final FlowProcessingEngine flowEngine;
040  private final PersistencePort persistence;
041  private final MetricsPort metrics;
042  private final Set<ProtocolId> enabledProtocols;
043  private final SegmentReaderFactory readerFactory;
044  private final FlowDirectionService orientations = new FlowDirectionService();
045
046  /**
047   * Creates an assemble use case with explicit dependencies.
048   *
049   * @param config assemble configuration
050   * @param flowAssembler flow assembler implementation
051   * @param protocolDetector protocol detector implementation
052   * @param reconstructorFactories factories for message reconstructors
053   * @param pairingFactories factories for pairing engines
054   * @param persistence persistence port
055   * @param metrics metrics port
056   * @param enabledProtocols protocols to process
057   * @param readerFactory factory for segment readers
058   */
059  public AssembleUseCase(
060      AssembleConfig config,
061      FlowAssembler flowAssembler,
062      ProtocolDetector protocolDetector,
063      Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<MessageReconstructor>> reconstructorFactories,
064      Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<PairingEngine>> pairingFactories,
065      PersistencePort persistence,
066      MetricsPort metrics,
067      Set<ProtocolId> enabledProtocols,
068      SegmentReaderFactory readerFactory) {
069    this.config = Objects.requireNonNull(config, "config");
070    this.persistence = Objects.requireNonNull(persistence, "persistence");
071    this.metrics = Objects.requireNonNull(metrics, "metrics");
072    this.enabledProtocols = Set.copyOf(Objects.requireNonNull(enabledProtocols, "enabledProtocols"));
073    this.readerFactory = Objects.requireNonNull(readerFactory, "readerFactory");
074    this.flowEngine =
075        new FlowProcessingEngine(
076            "assemble",
077            Objects.requireNonNull(flowAssembler, "flowAssembler"),
078            Objects.requireNonNull(protocolDetector, "protocolDetector"),
079            Objects.requireNonNull(reconstructorFactories, "reconstructorFactories"),
080            Objects.requireNonNull(pairingFactories, "pairingFactories"),
081            this.metrics,
082            this.enabledProtocols);
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Streams segment records through the flow engine and persists resulting message pairs.
087   *
088   * @throws Exception if reading records, processing flows, or persisting results fails
089   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
090   */
091  public void run() throws Exception {
092    MDC.put("assemble.in", config.inputDirectory().toString());
093    long segmentCount = 0;
094    long pairCount = 0;
095    try (PersistencePort sink = this.persistence;
096         SegmentRecordReader reader = readerFactory.open(config)) {
097      log.info("Assemble pipeline reading from {}", config.inputDirectory());
098      SegmentRecord record;
099      while ((record = reader.next()) != null) {
100        segmentCount++;
101        TcpSegment segment = toSegment(record);
102        String previousFlowId = MDC.get("flowId");
103        try {
104          MDC.put("flowId", formatFlow(segment.flow()));
105          List<MessagePair> pairs = flowEngine.onSegment(segment);
106          for (MessagePair pair : pairs) {
107            sink.persist(pair);
108            metrics.increment("assemble.pairs.persisted");
109            pairCount++;
110          }
111        } finally {
112          if (previousFlowId == null) {
113            MDC.remove("flowId");
114          } else {
115            MDC.put("flowId", previousFlowId);
116          }
117        }
118      }
119      sink.flush();
120      log.info("Assemble pipeline flushed {} message pairs from {} segments", pairCount, segmentCount);
121    } catch (Exception ex) {
122      log.error("Assemble pipeline failed after processing {} segments", segmentCount, ex);
123      throw ex;
124    } finally {
125      try {
126        flowEngine.close();
127        log.info("Assemble flow engine closed");
128      } catch (Exception ex) {
129        log.error("Failed to close assemble flow engine", ex);
130        throw ex;
131      } finally {
132        MDC.remove("assemble.in");
133      }
134    }
135  }
136
137  private TcpSegment toSegment(SegmentRecord record) {
138    FiveTuple flow = new FiveTuple(record.srcIp(), record.srcPort(), record.dstIp(), record.dstPort(), "TCP");
139    boolean fin = hasFlag(record.flags(), SegmentRecord.FIN);
140    boolean syn = hasFlag(record.flags(), SegmentRecord.SYN);
141    boolean rst = hasFlag(record.flags(), SegmentRecord.RST);
142    boolean psh = hasFlag(record.flags(), SegmentRecord.PSH);
143    boolean ack = hasFlag(record.flags(), SegmentRecord.ACK);
144
145    boolean fromClient =
146        orientations.fromClient(record.srcIp(), record.srcPort(), record.dstIp(), record.dstPort(), syn, ack);
147    if (fin || rst) {
148      orientations.forget(record.srcIp(), record.srcPort(), record.dstIp(), record.dstPort());
149    }
150
151    return new TcpSegment(
152        flow,
153        record.sequence(),
154        fromClient,
155        record.payload(),
156        fin,
157        syn,
158        rst,
159        psh,
160        ack,
161        record.timestampMicros());
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Checks whether a flag mask is set.
166   *
167   * @param flags bitmask to inspect
168   * @param mask mask to test
169   * @return {@code true} when the mask is present
170   */
171  private static boolean hasFlag(int flags, int mask) {
172    return (flags & mask) != 0;
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Reader abstraction over a source of serialized {@link SegmentRecord}s.
177   */
178  public interface SegmentRecordReader extends AutoCloseable {
179    /**
180     * Returns the next record or {@code null} when depleted.
181     *
182     * @return next record or {@code null} when complete
183     * @throws Exception if reading fails
184     */
185    SegmentRecord next() throws Exception;
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Factory for {@link SegmentRecordReader} instances tied to an {@link AssembleConfig} input.
190   */
191  @FunctionalInterface
192  public interface SegmentReaderFactory {
193    /**
194     * Opens a reader bound to the supplied configuration.
195     *
196     * @param config assemble configuration describing the source
197     * @return opened reader
198     * @throws Exception if the reader cannot be created
199     */
200    SegmentRecordReader open(AssembleConfig config) throws Exception;
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Creates a {@link SegmentReaderFactory} that streams serialized segments via {@link SegmentIoAdapter}.
205   *
206   * @return factory producing file-based segment readers
207   */
208  public static SegmentReaderFactory segmentIoReaderFactory() {
209    return config -> new SegmentIoAdapterRecordReader(new SegmentIoAdapter.Reader(config.inputDirectory()));
210  }
211
212  /**
213   * Concrete reader that adapts {@link SegmentIoAdapter.Reader} to the {@link SegmentRecordReader} interface.
214   */
215  private static final class SegmentIoAdapterRecordReader implements SegmentRecordReader {
216    private final SegmentIoAdapter.Reader delegate;
217
218    /**
219     * Creates a reader wrapper around the provided adapter.
220     *
221     * @param delegate underlying adapter
222     */
223    private SegmentIoAdapterRecordReader(SegmentIoAdapter.Reader delegate) {
224      this.delegate = delegate;
225    }
226
227    @Override
228    public SegmentRecord next() throws Exception {
229      return delegate.next();
230    }
231
232    @Override
233    public void close() throws Exception {
234      delegate.close();
235    }
236  }
237
238  /**
239   * Formats a five-tuple into a compact string for MDC logging.
240   *
241   * @param flow flow metadata to format
242   * @return compact textual representation
243   */
244  private static String formatFlow(FiveTuple flow) {
245    return flow.srcIp() + ":" + flow.srcPort() + "->" + flow.dstIp() + ":" + flow.dstPort();
246  }
247}
